CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (ratione temporis);Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Not necessary to examine art. 14;Just satisfaction reserved

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides :
“ In accordance with LAW , the arbitration tribunals shall have jurisdiction in economic cases .
The arbitration tribunal is an independent entity with jurisdiction in all economic cases between corporations , public or other bodies and litigation arising out of insolvency . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW provide :

“ Judgments and court orders or decisions which have become final may be reconsidered under the supervisory review procedure on an objection [ протест ] lodged by CARDINAL of the officials specified in LAW . ”

“ The following officials are empowered to lodge objections under the supervisory review procedure with a view to securing the revision of judgments and court orders or decisions which have become final :
( CARDINAL ) NORP the President of ORG , the Attorney - General and their deputies ... ;
( CARDINAL ) the presidents of ORG , the regional courts , ORG and ORG and their deputies , and ORG counsel at ORG , the regional courts , ORG and ORG and their deputies ... ;
( CARDINAL ) the presidents of the regional military tribunals and military or admiralty courts , military prosecutors ... and their deputies ... ”

“ The officials mentioned in LAW ... are empowered to require the relevant court to submit the file on a civil case to them so that they can decide whether there are grounds for an objection under the supervisory review procedure .

Where there are no grounds for an objection , the official concerned shall notify his or her decision to the person who requested revision , with a short statement of the reasons for it , the case being remitted to the relevant court . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW Procedure provide :

“ The lawfulness and merits of a judgment , order or decision of an arbitration tribunal ... may be reconsidered under the supervisory review procedure on an application by a party or an objection by ORG or his deputy , in accordance with the said LAW and other NORP laws .

An application by a party for revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure shall be examined by the President of ORG or his deputy , by the presidents of the regional arbitration tribunals , ORG or ORG or their deputies , or by a bench of ORG .
The following persons are empowered to lodge an objection :
The Attorney - General and his deputies ... ;
State counsel at the courts of GPE , the regions , GPE and GPE and their deputies ... ”

“ The President of ORG of GPE , the Attorney - General or his deputies shall be entitled to lodge an objection with the ORG of ORG seeking revision of a judgment of a bench of ORG in an economic case .
An objection by the Attorney - General or his deputy for revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure shall not stay execution of the decision concerned ... ”

“ An application by a party for revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure must be lodged within DATE of the date of the judgment , order or decision in question . ”
“ The parties may participate in proceedings for the revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure . ...
Revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure must be completed within DATE of the lodging of an application or objection . ...
The judgment , order or decision of the arbitration tribunal may be revised under the supervisory review procedure DATE after its delivery or issue . ”
“ Following revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure , an arbitration tribunal may :
( i ) leave the judgment , order or decision as it stands ;
( ii ) vary the judgment , order or decision ;
( iii ) quash the judgment , order or decision and adopt a new decision , adjourn the case for further consideration , close the case or decline to entertain the application .
The judgment , order or decision of the arbitration tribunal shall be examined as a whole , irrespective of the grounds for the application or objection .

An arbitration tribunal examining an application for revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure shall be vested with all the powers of an arbitration tribunal considering an economic dispute .
Where a judgment , order or decision has been revised under the supervisory review procedure by ORG , its judgment shall be final ... ”

“ Following revision under the supervisory review procedure of a judgment of ORG , a regional arbitration tribunal , ORG or ORG , the arbitration tribunal concerned shall issue , in the name of GPE , a reasoned decision .

The decision shall be signed by the President of ORG or his deputy , the President of the regional arbitration tribunal or his deputy , the President of ORG or his deputy or the President of ORG or his deputy .

Following revision under the supervisory review procedure of a judgment , order or decision of a bench of ORG , the bench concerned shall issue , in the name of GPE , a reasoned judgment signed by all its judges . ”

“ Directions set out in a judgment delivered following the revision of a judgment , order or decision under the supervisory review procedure shall be binding on the arbitration tribunal to which the case is remitted for retrial .

“ Judgment , orders and decisions of arbitration tribunals shall be effective on DATE they are delivered or issued and all undertakings , organisations and public authorities shall be bound to comply with them . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :

“ Everyone shall have a right to compensation from public or municipal bodies for losses sustained as a result of unlawful decisions , acts or omissions by public or municipal bodies or civil servants in the performance of their official duties . ”
“ Municipal bodies shall exercise their powers in accordance with the statutory rules of competence ; decisions of municipal bodies shall be mandatory in the area concerned .
Execution of decisions of municipal bodies shall be stayed , in accordance with the law , if their compatibility with the LAW or the legislation in force is contested in the courts or tribunals . ”
CARDINAL . Under this Act , the system of arbitration tribunals was replaced by a system of economic courts with jurisdiction to try disputes relating to economic matters .
Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that the system shall comprise CARDINAL levels of jurisdiction : district economic courts , economic courts of appeal and ORG of GPE .
CARDINAL . The Code of Economic Procedure of CARDINAL DATE ( as renamed and amended on DATE ) abolished the objection ( протест ) procedure .
Article CARDINAL provides that economic courts may grant extensions of time on an application by a party or ORG or on their own initiative .
Article CARDINAL lays down that appeals on points of law may be lodged DATE after the judgment of the district economic court or the economic court of appeal shall have become effective .
Article CARDINAL requires notices of appeal on points of law to be accompanied , inter alia , by evidence that the court fee has been paid to the court or tribunal .

LAW provides that courts and tribunals shall return notices of appeal on points of law to the appellant without examining the appeal on the merits if the appellant fails to furnish evidence that the court fee has been paid to the tribunal .

LAW provides that courts and tribunals shall return notices of appeal on points of law to the appellant without examining the appeal on the merits if it has been lodged out of time and the appellant has not applied for an extension of time .
